New Records: Bahrain have won their last three meetings with Malaysia, conceding just once over that stretch, and have never lost in five previous Asian Cup qualifiers against them.
Key Match Events: Madan scored the winning goal in the 90+5' for Bahrain.
Al Aswad scored in the 45+1' for Bahrain.
Kutty Abba (19') and Saad (52') scored for Malaysia.
Pre-Game Insights: Bahrain have won their last three games when scoring the opening goal, while failing to concede in any of those fixtures.
Bahrain have won their last three meetings with Malaysia, conceding just once over that stretch, and have never lost in five previous Asian Cup qualifiers against them.
Malaysia have put forth some solid performances overall of late, losing just one of their previous 11 games before their match on Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: Bahrain have suffered three successive defeats in all competitions, scoring just one goal over that stretch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bahrain's Amine Benaddi is doubtful for this match after the Bahraini centre-back had to be stretchered off the pitch with an injury at half time against the Koreans.
Malaysia's captain Matthew Davies can reach the half-century mark for international caps if he plays in their final two group fixtures.
